bug.summary: LearningRateMonitor does not work with wandb
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>üêõ Bug</denchmark-h>
Wandb rejects the logging of the learning rate. I guess this is because Lightning keeps another step index for epoch-wide metrics like LR. <denchmark-code>Epoch 1: 100%|‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà‚ñà| 626/626 [00:10<00:00, 60.98it/s, wandb: WARNING Step must only increase in log calls. Step 2 < 1125; dropping {'lr-Adam': 0.001}. </denchmark-code>
My code: <denchmark-code> lr_monitor_callback = pl.callbacks.LearningRateMonitor() early_stop_callback = pl.callbacks.EarlyStopping(monitor=hparams.monitor, min_delta=0.00, patience=hparams.early_stopping_patience, verbose=True, mode='min') checkpoint_callback = pl.callbacks.ModelCheckpoint(filepath=checkpoint_dir, monitor=hparams.monitor, save_top_k=1, verbose=True, mode='min') best_validation_callback = BestValidationCallback(hparams.monitor, hparams.use_wandb)
trainer = pl.Trainer.from_argparse_args(hparams, logger=logger, log_every_n_steps=1, checkpoint_callback=checkpoint_callback, callbacks=[early_stop_callback, lr_monitor_callback, best_validation_callback ])
</denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h3>Environment</denchmark-h>
python 3.7 ubuntu 18.04 pytorch-lightning 1.0.7 wandb 1.0.11
